abstract: Advocates supporting children's rights to sit out state tests in New York are targeting districts that require students to sit quietly in classrooms and do nothing; more districts are offering backup activities on testing days.
lead_paragraph: The anti-testing movement is targeting districts that require students not taking the exams to remain quietly in their classrooms and, as opt-out advocates have labeled it, “sit and stare.”

headline.main: Only Alternative for Some Students Sitting Out Standardized Tests: Do Nothing
headline.print_headline: Only One Alternative for Some Students Who Sit Out State Tests: Do Nothing
